get.description:
Returns Procedure based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination(stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for Procedure.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Procedure.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select Procedures based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select Procedures based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the Procedure. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the Procedure. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the Procedure. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of Procedures that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: Used to request the server to return a subset of the resource. It can contain one of the following values: true, false, text, data or count.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Used to search the entire content of the Procedure resource.

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Used to search on the narrative of the Procedure resource.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular Procedure, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes i.e. Procedure 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular Procedure, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes i.e. Procedure 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: Used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: A code to identify a procedure. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date the procedure was performed on. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <=, and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date the procedure was performed on. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). Two dates can be used to specify an interval. The prefixes >, >=, <=, and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: The encounter when procedure performed.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier for a procedure. Value can have following formats: [code] or [system]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Where the procedure happened.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The identity of a patient to list procedures for.

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: The reference to the practitioner.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search by Subject.

parameters.name: stateid
parameters.description: Unique id associated with a page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Procedure resource offset.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of Procedure resources requested in a page.

parameters.name: _pretty
parameters.description: Set true to get prettified data.

parameters.name: _bundletype
parameters.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle. Values can be one of: document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of Procedures based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.

It retrieves the history of all resources of Procedure.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of records needed in response.

parameters.name: _since
parameters.description: Specify an instant to only include resource versions that were created at or after the given instant in time. An instant in time is known at least to the second and always includes a time zone.
